intro: Crotalaria laxiflora var. acuta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow with prominent purple veins, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
